scenario_text.value:
(...There’s too many things we don’t know.
I wonder what Kaito thinks about this?)

Hey, Kaito. Do you think those creatures are
our enemies?

Who’s to say? We don’t have enough info to
decide one way or another.
Yeah, that’s what I figured...

For now, we have to find out more of the
truth. Even a scrap would help.

We can’t take any action without knowing more
about what’s going on.

It sucks not being able to do anything.
We gotta figure something out, and fast!

(Kaito’s rough in both words and deeds, but
at his core he’s a practical guy.)

(Probably helped him be a good brother. He
sure goes above and beyond for Miu.)

(Hm, or has he really seen a lot of fights?
He does kinda look like a delinquent.)
Um, Kaito...
Yeah?
(I’d say he’s pretty...)
Practical, actually.
Great as a brother.
Used to fighting?
You’re surprisingly practical, aren’t you?

Whaddaya mean, surprisingly? This is just
basic common sense.
Huh?
What?
Hmm...

Hold up, what’s with that blank stare? You
thought I was off my rocker or something?

Uhh, I mean, a bit off-kilter, maybe, but with
how you tend to act, anyone would think so!
What’s “common sense”?

Hahaha, that’s a deeper question than you
realize, Agumon.
Yo, don’t try and change the subject!

Hehehe, looks like my boy’s the only one who
didn’t know!
Don’t you friggin’ start, creepshow!
You’re great as a brother.
Wha’? Where the heck’d that come from?!
It just came to me while we were talking.

You’re reliable, help out in a pinch, and act
for others, even if you’re rough about it.
Who even asked you...?

I’m just expressing my honest opinion. “Man,
brothers sure are amazing,” I thought.

It’s not just Miu. You’re trying to protect
all of us.

It ain’t like I’m trying to keep you guys’
asses out of the fire or anything!

Oh? Speaking of fire, your face’s looking
hot, boyo. You feeling sick? Little sniffly?
Shaddup! Stop staring at me!
You’re pretty used to fights, huh?
What? The hell you trying to say?

It’s just, you’re so calm in a situation like
this. I can’t believe we’re the same age.
You must’ve been through a lot, I figured.
Oh... Eh, it ain’t nothing that special.

When we moved here—I mean, “here” back in our
world—some local jerks picked on us.

They ended up hurting Miu, so I ended up
knocking the crap out of them.
No way...

Some punk hid Miu’s shoes at school, so
I went and beat him till he was sorry.
Damn...
Oh, and one time before we moved, I—
All right, okay! I get it, enough!
Word? A’ight.
Looks like I was on the money...

I wouldn’t call those one-sided deals fights.
I don’t regret ’em, but I ain’t proud of ’em.

Miu wouldn’t have got hurt if I’d noticed.
There must’ve been better ways to handle it.

Shoot... All this chit-chat’s a time sink.
Better get back to work.
Oh and, what were you guys doing, anyway?

Taking stock of our food. It’ll be easier to
manage if we count and divvy the rest up.
Whoa... I knew you were reliable.
You’re awesome, Kaito!
Oh Captain, my Captain!

Shut it, all of you! And don’t think I don’t
know when I’m being mocked!
Sheesh... Huh?
Wait, where’d that canned food go?

Whatever, just don’t get complacent, okay?
I hate it when people use me.
